title: Proof Of Authority Blockchain geth attach default address unlocked
body:
Hello,
I have a very strange problem with my proof of authority blockchain. It is public, but when i connect with geth console using:
`geth attach myrpcurl console` the eth.accounts is not empty, and the first address is unlocked.

I tried to use this account to do a transaction to an other address and it is done

```
> eth.sendTransaction({from: eth.accounts[0], to: "0x53eaCf386176e165eA897bE327f4d7BB9fC7bEC3", value: web3.toWei(4, "ether")})
"0xca220581d7178bb2b75e1acad50e75ee5e1e445b97a52f5621023c327e25edda"
```

I followed this tutorial to create a my proof of authority blockchain: 
https://hackernoon.com/setup-your-own-private-proof-of-authority-ethereum-network-with-geth-9a0a3750cda8


And if i add --unlock '0x0d9AeD19dCF67eabCd0cb37015Ef48fF685338fB' --password node1/password.txt withouth --allow-insecure-unlock it return:
`Fatal: Account unlock with HTTP access is forbidden!`
and break the console
It is all very strange

A clique network needs an account to sign blocks with (since it's based on signatures, not on PoW), which is also the account that will be credited with the mining rewards. That account needs to be unlocked, because Geth needs access to it every time a new block is to be created in Clique networks. Thus a Clique signer will always need an unlocked account to create blocks with.

Forbidding unlocks with HTTP is because people too often publish their nodes publicly to the internet and then get surprised when someone connects to their node and uses their unlocked accounts. Don't expose HTTP to `0.0.0.0`, ever!

So this is a "feature" of proof of authority blockchain have all the account that sign blocks every accessible by geth.

I am developing my blockchain for have lower gas fee. I am building 3 DAPP that use my blockchain.
